intro: Campanula tridens var. araratica, commonly known as the Armenian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus. It is characterized by its bell-shaped blue or violet flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. This variety is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in gardens for its attractive flowers and hardy nature.
